strings_manipulation_introduction: Strings are sequences of characters used to represent text. JavaScript provides many methods to manipulate strings:
sm_characters_access_explanation: You can access a specific character in a string using bracket notation: 'string[index]'.
sm_concatenation_explanation: You can combine strings using the '+' operator or the 'concat()' function.
sm_search_and_replace_explanation_one: returns the first position at which a specified substring appears.
sm_search_and_replace_explanation_two: checks if the string contains a specific substring.
sm_slicing_and_extracting_explanation: extracts a section of a string and returns a new string.
sm_transformation_explanation: convert a string to uppercase or lowercase, respectively.
